description.narrative: One of the most apparent shortfalls in the current migration data space until recently was the absence of a comprehensive, one-stop-shop for migration information and data, both in the form of timely textual analysis, including the strengths and weaknesses of the data sources, and, in particular, for data access and analysis purposes. Many public policy communities, over the years, have suffered from a diffuse and confusing approach to information. At the same time some areas account for very advanced information. Economic development data is available, for example, on dozens of websites, as is information on public health issues. Since the launch of the Global Migration Data Portal, from herein after referred to as the Portal, in December 2017, the Portal has pursued a long-term strategy to become the primary point of departure for all stakeholders interested in migration data and to become an exchange platform for the international community of migration experts and agencies developed by IOM's Global Migration Data Analysis Centre, in partnership with key international experts and UN agencies, the portal strives to meet three goals: it must be useful, comprehensive andtimely. In this context, 'useful' means that the content is valuable to users, and that they will want to come back frequently for updates. 'Comprehensive' means that the Portal covers the widest range of countries and migration topics possible. This means that the Portal is not limited, as are other migration data-related websites, to a certain region or topic. Timely' means that the Portal uploads new migration data indicators as they are released, publishes blogs that cover emerging topics and videos with migration experts to explain ongoing migration topics in Europe, Africa, Asia and Latin America. In order to become a global reference point on migration data, the Portal must be expanded.
